meanings.definition: Ectogenes (noun): A hypothetical artificial environment in which a fetus can gestate outside the womb.
meanings.sent1: Scientists are researching ectogenes to support premature babies outside the womb.
meanings.sent2: The concept of ectogenes offers a new way to nurture developing fetuses.
meanings.sent3: In the sci-fi movie, characters escape to an ectogenes facility to protect the unborn babies.
meanings.sent4: The hospital's advanced technology resembled an ectogenes chamber, keeping the fetus safe.
meanings.sent5: The futuristic ectogenes pod glowed softly, cradling the tiny life within.

meanings.definition: Ectogenes (adjective): Relating to or characteristic of an artificial environment for gestating fetuses.
meanings.sent1: The ectogenes equipment was carefully designed to mimic a natural womb environment.
meanings.sent2: Doctors are studying the effects of ectogenes environments on fetal development.
meanings.sent3: The quirky scientist proudly showed off his latest ectogenes invention at the conference.
meanings.sent4: Her room had an ectogenes feel, with controlled temperature and lighting for comfort.
meanings.sent5: The artist's painting depicted a surreal landscape with ectogenes structures supporting life.
